Step 1: install YACC and flex
sudo apt-get install bison flex

Step 2: Create calc.l (refer README for steps to create)
%{
#include "y.tab.h"   // Include the header generated by Yacc
%}

%% 
[0-9]+               { yylval = atoi(yytext); return NUMBER; }
[\n]                 { return EOL; }
[+\-*/]              { return yytext[0]; }
[ \t]                { /* Ignore whitespace */ }
.                    { printf("Unknown character: %s\n", yytext); }
%%

Step 3: Create calc.y (same steps as .l file)
%{
#include <stdio.h>
#include <stdlib.h>
%}

%token NUMBER
%token EOL

%%
input:
    /* empty */
    | input line
    ;

line:
    '\n'
    | expr '\n'       { printf("Result: %d\n", $1); }
    ;

expr:
    NUMBER            { $$ = $1; }
    | expr '+' expr   { $$ = $1 + $3; }
    | expr '-' expr   { $$ = $1 - $3; }
    | expr '*' expr   { $$ = $1 * $3; }
    | expr '/' expr   { if ($3 == 0) {
                            printf("Error: Division by zero\n");
                            exit(1);
                        } else {
                            $$ = $1 / $3;
                        }
                      }
    ;
%%
int main() {
    printf("Enter expressions:\n");
    yyparse();
    return 0;
}

int yyerror(char *s) {
    fprintf(stderr, "%s\n", s);
    return 0;
}

(In terminal below)
Step 4: flex calculator.l 
Step 5: bison -d calculator.y
Step 6: gcc y.tab.c lex.yy.c -o calculator -lm
Step 7: ./calculator

**DONT FORGET TO CHANGE THE NAME IN THE COMMANDS AS PER YOUR SAVED FILE**
